info.title: Box Platform 2.0 APIs
info.description: The Box Content API gives you access to secure content management and content experience features for use in your own app. It strives to be RESTful and is organized around the main resources youâ€™re familiar with from the Box web interface.

get.description:
Authorize a user by sending them through the [Box](https://box.com)
website and request their permission to act on their behalf.

This is the first step when authenticating a user using
OAuth 2.0. To request a user's authorization to use the Box APIs
on their behalf you will need to send a user to the URL with this
format.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description:
The string value `"code"` is the only current value we support
for the OAuth2 grant type.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description:
The Client ID of the application that is requesting to authenticate
the user. To get the Client ID for your application, log in to your
Box developer console and click the **Edit Application** link for
the application you're working with. In the OAuth2 Parameters section
of the configuration page, find the item labeled **client_id**. The
text of that item is your application's Client ID.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description:
The URL to which Box redirects the browser after the user has granted
or rejected the application permission. This URL must match the
redirect URL in the configuration of your application. It must be a
valid HTTPS URL and it needs to be able to handle the redirection to
complete the next step in the OAuth2 flow.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
A custom string of your choice. Box will pass the same string to
the redirect URL when authentication is complete. This parameter
can be used to identify a user on redirect, as well as protect
against hijacked sessions and other attacks.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of application scopes you'd like to
authenticate the user for. This defaults to all the scopes configured
for the application in its configuration page.

200.description: Does not return any data, but rather should be used in the browser.

post.description:
Request an Access Token using either a client-side obtained OAuth2
authorization code or a server-side JWT assertion.

An Access Token is a string that enables Box to verify that a
request belongs to an authorized session. In the normal order of
operations you will begin by requesting authentication from the
[authorize](#get-authorize) endpoint and Box will send you an
authorization code.

You will then send this code to this endpoint to exchange it for
an Access Token. The returned Access Token can then be used to to make
Box API calls.

200.description:
Returns a new Access Token that can be used to make authenticated
API calls by passing along the token in a authorization header as
follows `Authorization: Bearer <Token>`

post.description:
Revoke an active Access Token, effectively logging a user out
that has been previously authenticated.

200.description: Returns an empty response when the token was successfully revoked.

get.description:
Retrieves a thumbnail, or smaller image representation, of a file.

Sizes of `32x32`,`64x64`, `128x128`, and `256x256` can be returned in
the `.png` format and sizes of `32x32`, `94x94`, `160x160`, and `320x320`
can be returned in the `.jpg` format.

Thumbnails can be generated for the image and video file formats listed
[found on our community site](http://community.box.com/t5/Managing-\
Your-Content/What-file-types-are-supported-by-Box-s-Content-Preview/\
ta-p/327).

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The file format for the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_height
parameters.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail

200.description:
When a thumbnail can be created the thumbnail data will be
returned in the body of the response.

202.description:
If the thumbnail is not available yet, a `Location` header
pointing to a placeholder graphic will be returned.

Retry-After.description:
The time in seconds after which the thumbnail will be available.

Your application  only attempt to get the thumbnail again after
this time.

Location.description:
A pointer to a placeholder graphic that can be used until the
thumbnail has been generated.

302.description:
If Box is unable to generate a thumbnail for this file type, a `Location`
header pointing to a placeholder graphic for this file type will be
returned.

Location.description:
A pointer to a placeholder graphic that can be used for this
file type.

404.description:
If Box is unable to generate a thumbnail for this particular file, `404`
will be returned with a code of `preview_cannot_be_generated`.

get.description:
Retrieves the details about a folder, including the first 100 entries
in the folder.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

200.description:
Returns a folder object, including the first 100 entries in the folder.

[Some fields are optional](#folder) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#get-folders-id--request--fields)
parameter.

default.description:
A client error can occur of the user does not have access to the folder,
the folder does not exists, or incorrect parameters are passed in the
request.

put.description:
Updates a folder. This can be also be used to move the folder,
create shared links, update collaborations, and more.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

name.description: The new name for the folder

sync_state.description: If Box Sync or Box Drive is allowed to sync this folder.

can_non_owners_invite.description:
If collaborators who are not
folder owners can invite new collaborators

is_collaboration_restricted_to_enterpris.description:
If future invites to this folder are restricted to users
within the enterprise. This does not affect existing
collaborations.

allOf.description: The parent folder for this folder
Enables the creation of a shared link for this folder

Enables an email address for users to upload
files directly to the folder
The user that owns this folder

tags.description:
The tags for this folder.

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the folderâ€™s current tags,
modify them, and then update them using this field.

collections.description: The collections this folder belongs to.

200.description:
Returns a folder object for the updated folder

[Some fields are optional](#folder) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#put-folders-id--request--fields)
parameter.

delete.description:
Deletes a folder, either permanently or by moving it to
the trash.

The the enterprise settings determine wether the item will
be permanently deleted from Box or moved to the trash.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description:
Delete a folder that is not empty by recursively deleting the
folder and all of its content.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

204.description:
Returns an empty response when the folder is successfully deleted
or moved to the trash.

get.description:
Retrieves a page of files, folders, web links, and other items contained
within the specified folder.

To request more information about the folder, use the
[Retrieve a folder](#get-folders-id-items) endpoint.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: A collection of items contained in the folder.

post.description: Creates a new empty folder within the specified parent folder.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

name.description: The name for the new folder

allOf.description: The parent folder

201.description:
Returns a folder object.

[Some fields are optional](#folder) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#post-folders--request--fields) parameter.

post.description:
Creates a copy of a folder in another folder. The original folder will
not be changed.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

name.description: An optional different name for the new folder

allOf.description: The parent folder

201.description:
Returns a new folder object representing the copied folder.

[Some fields are optional](#folder) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#post-folders-id-copy--request--fields)
parameter.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of collaborations for a folder folder. This
returns all the users that have access to the folder.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id `"0"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

200.description:
Returns a collection of collaboration objects. If there are no
collaborations on this folder an empty collection will be returned.

scopes.root_readonly: Read all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.root_readwrite: Read and write all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.manage_webhook: Create webhooks programmatically through the API

AccessToken.description: A token that can be used to make authenticated API calls

refresh_token.description:
The refresh token for this access token, which can be used
to request a new access token when the current one expires.

issued_token_type.description:
The type of downscoped access token returned. This is only
returned if an access token has been downscoped.

AccessToken--Mini.description: The basics of an access token

expires_in.description: The time in seconds in seconds by which this token will expire.

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

restricted_to.description:
The permissions that this access token permits,
providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

AssignmentCounts.description: Counts of assignments within this a legal hold policy by item type

user.description: The number of users this policy is applied to

folder.description: The number of folders this policy is applied to

file.description: The number of files this policy is applied to

file_version.description: The number of file versions this policy is applied to

status.description: The HTTP status of the response.

help_url.description: A URL that links to more information about why the error occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

request_id.description:
The unique ID for this request as can be used when contacting
Box support.

Collaboration.description:
Collaborations define access permissions for users and groups to files and
folders, similar to access control lists. A collaboration object grants a
user or group access to a file or folder with permissions defined by a
specific role.

allOf.description: The file or folder that access is granted to
The user or group that is granted access

invite_email.description:
The email address used to invite an unregistered collaborator, if
they are not a registered user.

can_view_path.description:
Whether the "view path collaboration" feature is enabled or not. View
path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire parent path to
the item. View path collaboration does not grant privileges in any
parent folder (e.g. cannot see content the user is not collaborated
on), other than the permission to view the parent path.

status.description: The status of the collaboration invitation.

acknowledged_at.description:
When the `status` of the collaboration object changed to
`accepted` or `rejected`

allOf.description: The user who created the collaboration object

created_at.description: When the collaboration object was created

modified_at.description: When the collaboration object was last modified

CollaborationWhitelistEntry.description:
A Collaboration Whitelist entry describes an
approved domains that can collaborate with your enterprise

direction.description: The direction of the collaborations to whitelist

allOf.description: The enterprise this whitelist is applied to

created_at.description: The time the whitelist entry was created

CollaborationWhitelistExemptTarget.description:
The record that represents a target user that is exempt from the
collaboration whitelist.

allOf.description: The enterprise this entry belongs to
The user that has been exempt

created_at.description: The time the entry was created

modified_at.description: The time the entry was modified

Comment.description:
Comments are messages created on files. Comments
can be made independently or created as responses to other
comments

tagged_message.description:
The string representing the comment text with
@mentions included. @mention format is @[id:username]
where `id` is user's Box ID an username is
their display name.

Comment--Standard.description:
Standard representation of a comment, as returned by the
comment API endpoints and when nested within other resources.

is_reply_comment.description:
Whether or not this comment is a reply to another
comment

message.description: The text of the comment, as provided by the user

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the author of the
comment

created_at.description: The time this comment was created

modified_at.description: The time this comment was last modified

allOf.description: The object this comment was placed on

DevicePinner.description:
Device pins allow enterprises to control what devices can
use native Box applications.

allOf.description: The user that the device pin belongs to

product_name.description: The type of device being pinned

created_at.description: The time the device pin was created

modified_at.description: The time the device pin was modified

Enterprise.description: A representation of a Box enterprise

Event.description: The description of an event that happened within Box

event_id.description: The ID of the event object. You can use this to detect duplicate events

allOf.description:
The user that performed the action represented by the event.
Some events may be performed by users not logged into Box.
In that case, not all attributes of the object are populated and the
event is attributed to a unknown user (`user_id = 2`)
The event type that triggered this event

session_id.description:
The session of the user that performed the action. Not all events will
populate this attribute.

allOf.description: The object that triggered this event

additional_details.description:
This object provides additional information about the event if available.

This can include how a user performed an event as well as additional
information to correlate an event to external Keysafe logs. Not all events
have an additional_details object.  This object is only available in the
Enterprise Events.

EventType.description: An event type that can trigger an event

File.description:
A full representation of a file, as can be returned from any
file API endpoints by default

version_number.description: The version number of this file

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this file

allOf.description:
An object containing the permissions that the current user has
for this item

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

allOf.description:
The lock held on this file. If there is no lock, this can either
be `null` or have a timestamp in the past.

extension.description:
Indicates the suffix, when available, on the file. By default,
set to an empty string. The suffix usually indicates the encoding
(file format) of the file contents or usage.

is_package.description: Whether the file is a package. Used for Mac Packages used by iWorks.

expiring_embed_link.description:
An expiring URL for an embedded preview session in an iframe.
This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will
expire after 60 minutes.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this file

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
Folder [collaboration](#collaboration-object) roles allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this file is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this file has any collaborators.

additionalProperties.description: The template name for the metadata

File--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a file, as returned from any
file API endpoints by default

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of the file.

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can
easily go into [exponent notation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/\
Double-precision_floating-point_format).

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this file, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was upload to Boxâ€™s servers

modified_at.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted

content_created_at.description: When this file was created originally

content_modified_at.description: When this file was last updated

expires_at.description: When the file will automatically be deleted

allOf.description: The user who created this file
The user who last modified this file
The user who owns this file

The shared link object for this file. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.
The folder that contains this file.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

File--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description: A unique ID for use with the /events endpoint

etag.description:
The entity tag of this file object. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

FileScope.description: A relation between a file and the scopes for which the file can be accessed

allOf.description: The file for which the file can be accessed

scope.description: The file scopes for the file access

FileVersion.description: A full representation of a file version

name.description: The name of the file version

size.description: Size of the file version in bytes

created_at.description: When the file version object was created

modified_at.description: When the file version object was last updated

allOf.description: The user who last updated the file version

trashed_at.description: When the file version object was trashed.

purged_at.description: When the file version object was purged.

FileVersion--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of this file.

FileVersionRetention.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can apply policies to
specified folders, or an entire enterprise. A file version retention
is a  record for a retained file version. To use this feature,
you must  have the manage retention policies scope enabled for your
API key via  your application management console. For more information
about retention policies, please visit our help documentation

allOf.description:
The file version this file version retention was
applied to
The file this file version retention was applied to

applied_at.description:
When this file version retention object was
created

disposition_at.description:
When the retention period expires on this file
version retention

allOf.description:
The winning retention policy applied to this file
version retention. A file version can have multiple
retention policies applied.

Folder.description:
A full representation of a folder, as can be returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

sync_state.description: If Box Sync or Box Drive is allowed to sync this folder.

has_collaborations.description: If this folder has any collaborators.

allOf.description:
The permissions that the current user has
for this item

tags.description:
The tags for this folder.

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the folderâ€™s current tags,
modify them, and then update them using this field.

can_non_owners_invite.description:
If collaborators who are not
folder owners can invite new collaborators

is_externally_owned.description: If this folder is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

is_collaboration_restricted_to_enterpris.description:
If future invites to this folder are restricted to users
within the enterprise. This does not affect existing
collaborations.

allowed_shared_link_access_levels.description:
The default access level settings for shared links as set
by the administrator.

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
The types of collaborations that have been allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this folder

Folder--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a folder, as returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

created_at.description:
The time the folder was created.  May be `null` for some folders such
as root or trash.

size.description:
The folder size in bytes.

Be careful parsing this integer as it can easily
go into exponent notation.

path_collection.description:
The tree of folders that this folder is contained in,
starting at the root.

allOf.description: The user who created this folder
The user who last modified this folder.

trashed_at.description: The time at which this folder was put in the trash.

purged_at.description: The time at which this folder will be purged from the trash.

content_created_at.description:
The time at which this folder was originally created according
to the uploader.

content_modified_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were last modified according to
the uploader.

expires_at.description: The time and which the folder will be automatically be deleted.

allOf.description: The user who owns this folder.

The shared link object for this folder. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

access.description:
If set, users can email files to the automatically
created email address to upload files to the
folder. To get the email address, request the
`folder_upload_email` field for the folder after setting
this field.

When set to `collaborators`, only emails from registered email
addresses for collaborators will be accepted.

email.description:
The upload email address for this folder. This will be
`null` if not enabled.

allOf.description:
The direct parent folder that this folder is located within.

May be `null` for folders such as root, trash and child folders
whose parent is inaccessible.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not.

Values include `active` if the item has not been trashed,
`trashed` if the item has been moved to the trash, and
`deleted` if the item has been permanently deleted.

item_collection.description: A collection of mini file and folder objects contained in this folder.

Folder--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some folders, such as root or trash.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this folder object. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

FolderUploadEmail.description: The writable Folder Upload Email object

access.description:
If set, users can email files to the automatically
created email address to upload files to the
folder. To get the email address, request the
`folder_upload_email` field for the folder after setting
this field.

When set to `collaborators`, only emails from registered email
addresses for collaborators will be accepted.

Group.description:
Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of
users in some operations, such as collaborations.

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups",
"Facebook Groups").  Setting this will
also prevent Box users from editing the group name
and its members directly via the Box web application.
This is desirable for one-way  syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group. Example values of this field
could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google
Group ID.  We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: Human readable description of the group.
description.example: Support Group - as imported from Active Directory

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders (Create Collaboration).

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of the group
(Get Memberships for Group).

* `admins_only - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin
* `admins_and_members` - all admins and group members
* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the
  enterprise

Group--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a group, as returned from any
group API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the group object was created

modified_at.description: When the group object was last modified

Group--Mini.description:
Mini representation of a group, including id and name of
group.

GroupMembership.description:
Membership is used to signify that a user is part of a
group.

allOf.description: The user that the membership applies to
The group that the membership applies to

role.description: The role of the user in the group.

created_at.description: The time this membership was created.

modified_at.description: The time this membership was last modified.

ItemReference.description: A generic mini representation of a file, folder, user or enterprise

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some items, such as root or trash.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this item. Used with If-Match headers.
May be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.

ItemReferenceCollection.description: A list of generic mini representations of a file, folder, user or enterprise

LegalHold.description:
File-Version-Legal-Hold is an entity representing all
holds on a File Version.

allOf.description: The file version that is held

The file for the file version held.
Note that there is no guarantee that the current
version of this file is held.

legal_hold_policy_assignments.description: List of assignments contributing to this Hold.

deleted_at.description:
Time that this File-Version-Legal-Hold was
deleted.

LegalHoldPolicy.description:
Legal Hold Policy information describes the basic
characteristics of the Policy, such as name, description,
and filter dates.

policy_name.description: Name of the legal hold policy.

description.description:
Description of the legal hold policy. Optional
property with a 500 character limit.

status.description:
* 'active' - the policy is not in a transition state
* 'applying' - that the policy is in the process of
  being applied
* 'releasing' - that the process is in the process
  of being released
* 'released' - the policy is no longer active

allOf.description: Counts of assignments within this policy by apply-to type
The user who created the legal hold policy object

created_at.description: When the legal hold policy object was created

modified_at.description:
When the legal hold policy object was modified.
Does not update when assignments are added or removed.

deleted_at.description:
When the policy release request was sent. (Because
it can take time for a policy to fully delete, this
isn't quite the same time that the policy is fully deleted).

If `null`, the policy was not deleted.

filter_started_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

filter_ended_at.description:
User-specified, optional date filter applies to
Custodian assignments only

release_notes.description: Optional notes about why the policy was created.

LegalHoldPolicyAssignment.description:
Legal Hold Assignments are used to assign Legal Hold
Policies to Users, Folders, Files, or File Versions.

Creating a Legal Hold Assignment puts a hold
on the File-Versions that belong to the Assignment's
'apply-to' entity.

allOf.description:
The policy that the legal hold policy assignment
is part of

The entity that the legal hold policy assignment
is assigned to. Includes type and ID.

The user who created the legal hold policy
assignment

assigned_at.description:
When the legal hold policy assignment object was
created

deleted_at.description:
When the assignment release request was sent.
(Because it can take time for an assignment to fully
delete, this isn't quite the same time that the
assignment is fully deleted). If null, Assignment
was not deleted.

Lock.description: The lock held on a file.

allOf.description: The use who created the lock

created_at.description: The time this lock was created at

expired_at.description: The time this lock is to expire at, which might be in the past

is_download_prevented.description: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked

Metadata.description:
The metadata as applied by a metadata template to a file or
folder

$canEdit.description: Whether the user can edit this metadata

$id.description: 36-character UUID to identify the metadata object

$parent.description: An ID for the parent folder

$scope.description:
An ID for the scope in which this template
has been applied

$type.description:
A unique identifier for the "type" of this instance. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$typeVersion.description:
The last-known version of the template of the object. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$version.description:
The version of the metadata object. Starts at 0 and increases every time
a user-defined property is modified.

MetadataCascadePolicy.description:
A cascade policy that applies to metadata policy template
to a folder

id.description: The ID of the metadata cascade policy object

owner_enterprise.description: The enterprise that owns the policy.

id.description: The ID of the enterprise that owns the policy.

parent.description: Represent the folder the policy is applied to

id.description: The ID of the folder the policy is applied to

scope.description:
The scope of the target instance that will be cascaded down. The `scope`
and `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the folder that is
to be cascaded down. Today, only `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are
supported.

templateKey.description:
The template key of the target metadata template to cascade down.
The `scope` & `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the f
older that is to be cascaded down.

MetadataTemplate.description: A template for metadata as can be applied to files and folders

templateKey.description:
A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across
the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being
applied.

scope.description:
The scope of the object. `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are supported.

The `global` scope contains the template with a key of `properties`,
while the enterprise scope pertains to custom templates created within
the enterprise.

 The ID of the enterprise will be appended to the enterprise scope.

displayName.description: The display name of the template

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

fields.description: The ordered set of key:value pairs for the template.

MetadataTemplateField.description:
An ordered set of key-value pairs that are part of a
metadata template

type.description: The data type of the field's value

key.description:
A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must
be unique within the template to which it belongs.

displayName.description: The display name of the field.

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

MetadataTemplateFieldOption.description:
For type `enum` and `multiSelect`, one of the potential values
that can be selected

key.description: The text value of the option

error.description: The type of the error returned.

error_description.description: The type of the error returned.

id.description: The ID of user that owns this item.

Pagination.description: The part of an API response that describes pagination

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

offset.description:
The 0-based offset of the first entry in this set. This will be the same
as the `offset` query parameter.

order.description: The order by which items are returned

PaginationOrder.description: The order in which a pagination is ordered

direction.description: The direction to order by, either ascending or descending

Permissions.description: The part of an API response that describes permissions

can_access.description: Whether the current user can access the item

can_upload.description: Whether the current user can upload to the item

can_rename.description: Whether the current user can rename the item

can_delete.description: Whether the current user can delete the item

can_share.description: Whether the current user can share the item

can_invite_collaborator.description: Whether the current user can invite collaborators to the item

can_set_share_access.description: Whether the current user can set share permissions for the item

RecentItem.description:
Recent Items returns information about files that have
been accessed by a user recently. It keeps track of items
that were accessed either in the last 90 days or the last
1000 items accessed

allOf.description: The item that was recently accessed.

interaction_type.description:
The most recent type of access the user performed on
the item.

interacted_at.description: The time of the most recent interaction.

interaction_shared_link.description:
If the item was accessed through a shared link it will appear here,
otherwise this will be null.

Reference.description: The bare basic reference for an object

type.description: The type of object, defaults to `folder`

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention Policy Object
RetentionPolicy.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention
policies and then later assign them to specific folders
or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must
have the manage retention policies scope enabled
for your API key via your application management console.

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This length
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has A `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy time period has passed.

status.description:
The status of the retention policy. The status of
a policy will be `active`, unless explicitly retired by an
administrator, in which case the status will be `retired`.
Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become
active again.

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy

created_at.description: When the retention policy object was created

modified_at.description: When the retention policy object was last modified

RetentionPolicy--Mini.description: Mini representation of the retention policy

policy_name.description: The name given to the retention policy

RetentionPolicyAssignment.description:
The retention policy assignment endpoint provides a way
for admins to apply a retention policy on a per-folder
basis, or place a blanket policy over the entire
enterprise.

allOf.description:
A mini retention policy object representing the
retention policy that has been assigned to this content

The `type` and `id` of the content that is under
retention. The `type` can either be `folder` or `
enterprise`.

A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy assignment object

assigned_at.description:
When the retention policy assignment object was
created

SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box
using a URL. Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriate authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL to access the item on Box.  If entered in a browser, this URL will
display the item in Box's preview UI.  If a custom URL is set this field
will return the custom URL, but the original URL will also continue to
work.

download_url.description:
The "direct Link" URL to download the item.  If entered in a browser, this
URL will trigger a download of the item.  This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level specified when the shared link was created. Can be `open`
("People with the link"), `company` ("People in your company"), or
`collaborators` ("People in this folder").  When creating a shared link,
if you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default
access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link.  This can be lower than
the value in the `access` field if the enterprise settings restrict the
allowed access levels.

unshared_at.description:
The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Whether the shared link has a password set

can_download.description:
Whether the shared link allows downloads.  For shared links on
folders, this also applies to any items in the folder. Can only be set
with access levels `open` and `company` (not `collaborators`).

can_preview.description:
Whether the shared link allows previewing.  Always `true`.  For shared
links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times the item has been downloaded

preview_count.description: The number of times the item has been previewed

SharedLink--Writable.description: The writable attributes for a Shared Link.

access.description:
The level of access for the shared link. This can be
restricted to anyone with the link (`open`), only people
within the company (`company`) and only those who
have been invited to the folder (`collaborators`).

This field defaults to default access level
specified by the enterprise admin.

password.description:
The password required to access the shared link. Set this to
`null` to remove the password.

unshared_at.description:
The timestamp at which this shared link will
be disabled. This field can only be set by
users with paid accounts.

can_download.description:
If the shared link allows for downloading of files.
This can only be set when `access` is set to
`open` or `company`.

api_key.description: The client ID of the application

SkillInvocation.description:
The payload of a Box skill as sent to a Custom Skill's
`invocation_url`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the invocation request.

allOf.description: The skill that triggered this invocation

token.description: The read-only and read-write access tokens for this item

state.description:
The state of this event.

* `invoked` - Triggered the skill with event details to start
  applying skill on the file.
* `processing` - Currently processing.
* `success` - Completed processing with a success.
* `transient_failure` - Encountered a failure which can be
  retried.
* `permanent_failure` -  Encountered a permanent failure and
  retry would not help.

error_code.description: Error code information, if error occurred.

created_at.description: The time this invocation was created.

allOf.description: The enterprise that this invocation was triggered for
The item that caused the invocation to trigger
The event that triggered this invocation

StoragePolicy.description: The Storage Policy object describes the storage zone.

name.description: A descriptive name of the region

StoragePolicy--Mini.description: A mini description of a Storage Policy object

StoragePolicyAssignment.description: The assignment of a storage policy to a user or enterprise

allOf.description: The assigned storage policy
The enterprise or use the policy is assigned to

Task.description:
Tasks enabled file-centric workflows in Box. Users can
create tasks on files and assign them to collaborators on
Box.

allOf.description: The file associated with the task

action.description:
The action the task assignee will be prompted to
do.

message.description: A message that will be included with the task

allOf.description:
A collection of task assignment objects
associated with the task

is_completed.description: Whether the task has been completed

allOf.description: The user who created the task

created_at.description: When the task object was created

TaskAssignment.description: An assignment of a task to a file and user

allOf.description: The file the task has been assigned to
The user the task has been assigned to

message.description:
A message that will be included with this task
assignment

completed_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
completed

assigned_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
assigned

reminded_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
reminded

allOf.description: The user who assigned this task

TermsOfService.description:
The root-level record that is supposed to represent a
single Terms of Service.

status.description: Whether these terms are enabled or not

allOf.description: The enterprise these terms apply to

tos_type.description: Whether to apply these terms to managed users or external users

text.description:
The text for your terms and conditions. This text could be
empty if the status is disabled
text.example: By using this service, you agree to ...

created_at.description: When the legal item was created

modified_at.description: When the legal item was modified.

TermsOfService--Mini.description:
The root-level record that is supposed to represent a
single Terms of Service.

TermsOfServiceUserStatus.description: The association between a Terms of Service and a user

allOf.description: The terms of service
The user

is_accepted.description: If the user has accepted the terms of services

created_at.description: When the legal item was created

modified_at.description: When the legal item was modified.

TokenRequest.description: A request for a new OAuth2 token

grant_type.description:
The type of request being made, either using a client-side obtained
authorization code, a refresh token, a JWT assertion, or another access
token for the purpose of downscoping a token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

code.description:
The client-side authorization code passed to your application by
Box in the browser redirect after the user has successfully
granted your application permission to make API calls on their
behalf.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` as the `grant_type`.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token used to get a new access token with.

Used in combination with `refresh_token` as the `grant_type`.

assertion.description:
A JWT assertion for which to request a new access token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token.description:
The token to exchange for a downscoped token. This can be a regular
access token, a JWT assertion, or an app token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token_type.description:
The type of `subject_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token.description:
The actor token used to create an annotator token.
This is a JWT assertion.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token_type.description:
The type of `actor_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

scope.description:
The space-delimited list of scopes that you want apply to the
new access token.

The `subject_token` will need to have all of these scopes or
the call will error with **401 Unauthorized**.

resource.description: Full URL for the file that the token should be generated for.

TokenRevocationRequest.description: A request to revoke an OAuth2 token

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting to revoke the
access token.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting to revoke
an access token.

User.description:
A full representation of a user, as can be returned from any
user API endpoints by default

tracking_codes.description: An array of key/value pairs set by the userâ€™s admin

can_see_managed_users.description: Whether the user can see other enterprise users in her contact list

is_sync_enabled.description: Whether the user can use Box Sync

is_external_collab_restricted.description:
Whether the user is allowed to collaborate with users outside her
enterprise

is_exempt_from_device_limits.description: Whether to exempt the user from Enterprise device limits

is_exempt_from_login_verification.description: Whether the user must use two-factor authentication

allOf.description: Representation of the userâ€™s enterprise

my_tags.description:
Tags for all files and folders owned by the user. Values returned
will  only contain tags that were set by the requester.

hostname.description:
The root (protocol, subdomain, domain) of any links that need to be
generated for the user

is_platform_access_only.description: Whether the user is an App User

User--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a user, as returned from any
user API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the user object was created

modified_at.description: When the user object was last modified

space_amount.description: The userâ€™s total available space amount in bytes

space_used.description: The amount of space in use by the user

max_upload_size.description: The maximum individual file size in bytes the user can have

avatar_url.description: URL of the userâ€™s avatar image

User--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a user, used when
nested under another resource.

login.description: The email address the user uses to log in

Watermark.description:
A watermark is a semi-transparent overlay on an embedded file
preview that displays a viewer's email address or user ID
and the time of access over a file's content

created_at.description: When this watermark was created

WatermarkInfo.description: The watermark information about this item

is_watermarked.description: Whether the item is watermarked or not.

allOf.description:
A reference to the item that will be monitored
and webhooks created for
The user who created the webhook

created_at.description:
A timestamp identifying the time that
the webhook was created.

address.description: The URL that is notified by this webhook

triggers.description:
An array of event names that this webhook is
to be triggered for

WebhookEvent.description: The event that is sent to a webhook address when an event happens

allOf.description: The webhook object that triggered this event
The user that triggered this event

created_at.description:
A timestamp identifying the time that
the webhook event was triggered.

allOf.description: The event name that triggered this webhook
The item that caused the event to trigger

WebhookTrigger.description: The event name that triggered this webhook

WebLink.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

allOf.description: The parent object the web link belongs to

url.description: The URL this web link points to

description.description:
The description accompanying the web link. This is
visible within the Box web application.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this link, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was created on Boxâ€™s servers.

modified_at.description:
When this file was last updated on the Box
servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

allOf.description: The user who created this web link
The user who last modified this web link
The user who owns this web link

The shared link object for this item. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted
